result.execSummary:
The defendant Shmeal B. Irby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Traffic Food Stamps (>=$5000), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.92(2)(g).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing June 18, 2015.
*6/18/2015    Ordered in amount of $27,847.00 to be paid to Wisconsin  Department Health Services, attention Vickie C.  To be paid out ouf up to 25% prison funds. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge (count one only).  To be paid out of up to 25% prison wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, but consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 36 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community or victims.

Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobtriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.  Conditions apply to both counts/case.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA sample as to count one only, if not already done.
Defendant advised she may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  Credit for 36 days.
*Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one year Initial Confinement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shmeal B. Irby

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed:  Decision and Order Denying Request to Modify Sentence.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to serve sentence concurrent with Winnebago County case 14CF399.

Defendant Shmeal B. Irby in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Shmeal B. Irby in custody.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter in court for restitution hearing.  Parties stipulate to the amount of $27,847.00.   Defense counsel motions the court for a lower amount of $10,000.00.  Court denied defense's motion and ordered restitution in the amount of $27,847.00 to be paid to Wisconsin Department Health Services, attention Vickie C. to be paid out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (37 pages) commencing May 12, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Shmeal B. Irby in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Defendant Shmeal B. Irby in custody.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Restitution to be determined.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  
COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, concurrent with Count 2, but consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 36 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with victims.
COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 2 years, concurrent with Count 1.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 1 year with credit for 36 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with victims.
COUNTS 1 AND 2:
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample (as to COUNT 1 only)  if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge (COUNT 1 only), out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from Defendant received and filed with court.

Defendant Shmeal B. Irby in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNTS 3 and 4 DISMISSED and read in.  As to COUNTS 1 and 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.      Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shmeal B. Irby in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  NO PLEA ENTERED.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Shmeal B. Irby in court with attorney Mark S. Tishberg.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Arraignment scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/14/15 @ 1:30pm
